page.title: 03YOUNGSBURY ESTATE.
page.content: The most impressive estate in the Rib valley is "YOUNGSBURY" . The house is large and overlooks the valley from the north side. It is set in a large area of parkland,part of which was landscaped by{Capability Brown.}He said of the estate;{"nature had done {so much,little was wanting, but {enlarging the river".}The estate has apparently changed very little since that time. Coniferous forest has been planted on the edge,to obscure the A.10 from the house. Most of the estates' woodland is commercially managed. A Roman building once stood here and at the 2 tumuli in Hilly field,fine glass vessels and iron objects (now in St. Albans museum) were found. The first record of the present manor was in 1426.The proposed A.10 by-pass,threatens some of the land of the estate.
